chapter.title: Invoicing Sheets
chapter.para: A key feature of Time and Expense is the ability to Invoice from Time Sheets. The time and expense lines that are entered can be invoiced a number of different ways. In this chapter we will review the various methods of invoicing. The following topics will be covered:

section.title: Approving Sheets
section.para: Before you can create and invoice for a Time Sheet you must first approve the Sheet. Approving Sheets is performed in the Open Sheets screen. For this scenario, we'll need to select a single Sheet to begin. To select a Sheet, follow these steps:

listitem.para: Follow this path: CRM > Project > Time and Expense...
Right click on the open Sheet

tip.para: Some of the button options available in the toolbar may be disabled if you do not have the appropriate privileges. For more information, please see .

section.para: Let's approve the open Sheet. To get started, follow these steps:

listitem.para: Right click and select the "Approve" option. The Sheet is now approved and ready for invoicing and vouchering.
A second option is to highlight the Sheet and click the APPROVE button on the upper toolbar.

section.title: Invoicing Specific Sheets
section.para: The invoicing of specific Sheets is performed in the Open Sheets screen. For this scenario, we'll need to select a single Sheet to begin. To select a Sheet, follow these steps:

listitem.para: Follow this path: CRM > Project > Time and Expense...

tip.para: Some of the button options available in the toolbar may be disabled if you do not have the appropriate privileges. For more information, please see .

section.para: Select the Invoice check box at the bottom of the screen and click the PROCESS button or use the right-click "Process" option to generate an Invoice. The Invoice Status will change to 'Yes' for Completed.
Next follow these steps to review the unposted Invoice:

listitem.para: Follow this path: Accounting > Accounts Receivable > Invoice > List Unposted...
Edit the Invoice in order to review the details.

note.para: The Notes from the Time entry are passed through to the Invoice Item. These Notes will print on the Invoice and provide greater detail for the billing line

section.title: Consolidated Invoicing
section.para: The generation of Consolidated Invoices is performed in the Open Sheets screen. For this scenario, we'll select multiple Sheets to begin. To select multiple Sheets, follow these steps:

note.para: Consolidation will happen by Sheet Date, Customer, Purchase Order, and Project.

listitem.para: Select multiple Sheets that have been approved
Click the PROCESS button or use the right-click "Process" option to generate the consolidated Invoice.

note.para: The Invoice Status changes to "Yes" for Completed.

listitem.para: Follow this path: Accounting > Accounts Receivable > Invoice > List Unposted...

section.para: Once you have located the Invoice in the list, you can open it to edit it or simply review the details.
